    • Controller

      public Controller()

  • Method Details

    • orderedSumUpdate

      private void orderedSumUpdate()
      Function updating sum of product amount from ACTIVE orders.

    • offlineSave

      private void offlineSave()
      Handles the click event of the "saveButton" button. Function uses offlineDB`s saveToFile function to serialize all objects which currently hold our data.

    • hoverOverButtonEnter

      private void hoverOverButtonEnter(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the 'On Mouse Entered' event of the buttons. Function changes the background color of buttons, when cursor hovers over them.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • hoverOverButtonExit

      private void hoverOverButtonExit(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the 'On Mouse Exited' event of the buttons. Changes the background color of buttons, when cursor stops hovering over them.
      Parameters:
      event - The event triggered by "On Mouse Exited" action.

    • deleteDataAction

      private void deleteDataAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Function creates a pop-up window to confirm deletion of selected record, after which (if acceptBtn clicked) proceeds to delete it from database.
      Parameters:
      event - The event triggered by clicking "deleteButton" button.

    • enterModifyState

      private void enterModifyState()
      Puts the application's UI into 'modify state'. In this state, certain UI components are disabled, hidden, or made editable to allow the user to modify the data of a selected record. This method is triggered by an action, such as clicking a "modifyButton" button. Note: This method assumes the availability of various UI components (e.g., myTable, tableSearchBar, etc.).

    • acceptDataAction

      private void acceptDataAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Function updates existing or adds new record, based on action preceding it (e.g. "enterModifyState", "enterNewDataState").
      Parameters:
      event - The event triggered by clicking an "acceptButton" button.

    • exitModifyState

      private void exitModifyState()
      Lets the application's UI to exit 'modify state'. This method is triggered by an action, such as clicking a "cancelButton" button or simply after finishing of adding, updating or deletion of record. Note: This method assumes the availability of various UI components (e.g., myTable, tableSearchBar, etc.).

    • enterNewDataState

      private void enterNewDataState()
      Handles the click event of "addButton" button. Function uses "enterModifyState" function and sets default values for elements.

    • handleRowSelect

      private void handleRowSelect()
      Handles selection of a record from 'left wing' of app, and displays it`s complete record information on 'right wing'.

    • searchFunction

      private void searchFunction()
      Handles event in which one of the search elements (e.g. tableSearchBar) has been updated.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resource)
      Initializes the application's user interface upon startup. This method is automatically called by JavaFX after the FXML file is loaded.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resource - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.
